intro: Vitex rabenantoandroi, commonly known as the Madagascar chaste tree, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, typical of the Vitex genus. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in dry forests and scrublands. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
